forum.name: Discussion 1A: Participant Introductions
forum.intro:
Please post your introduction to this Discussion Forum.

Include in your introduction:

  • your name and location (include your state!),
  • a brief description of the students/classes you teach,
  • your experience(s) with using Explicit Instruction, and
  • what needs, concerns, goals etc. drew you to participate in this course.

 

Instructions for Posting to Forums:

(1) Click on the "Add a new discussion topic" near the bottom of your screen.
You should now see a new section titled, "Your new discussion topic. You may have to scroll down.

(2) Type your introduction. Insert "Introduction - Your Name" in the subject line.
In the message box, type your responses to the questions above. You may attach a photo if you wish.

(3) Save and share your post. When you are finished typing your introduction:

  1.  click on the drop down list under the message box to choose whether or not you want to receive emails of this forums' posts, and then
  2.  click on the "Post to Forum" button.

To "meet" other participants via the Forum:

Once you have posted your introduction, click on the links below to read and reply to other participants' introductions. Check back to this forum frequently (or select emails for this forum) to enhance your interaction with others in the course.

 

Once You Have Completed Your Post:

Click on an "Explicit Instruction" link at the top of this page (or at left under "Current Course") to return to the Main Course Outline and access the next course activity.
Note:  This item will not automatically mark itself complete on the main course outline until you have posted.
